means: 不觉痛苦的，不受伤害的，无感觉的

sentence.Network_en: He was impassible before victory, before danger, before defeat.
sentence.Network_cn: 他面对胜利 、 危险 、 失败均能处之泰然.

sentence.Network_en: Eliza sat cold, impassible, and assiduously industrious.
sentence.Network_cn: 伊丽莎冷冷地, 无动于衷地坐着, 勤奋地干着活儿.

sentence.Network_en: EXAMPLE : During the rainy season the valley became an impassible morass.
sentence.Network_cn: 雨季的山谷变成了不可通行的沼泽.

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: via Old French from ecclesiastical Latin impassibilis, from Latin in- 'not' + passibilis (see passible)

auth_sentence.content: During this time, the roads are impassible.
auth_sentence.res_content: During this time, the roads are impassible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: During this time, the roads are impassible.

auth_sentence.content: But impassible roads have stymied the rescue effort.
